p: As recent dengue studies in Malaysia show a shifting age distribution toward infections amongst adults [ 5– 7], we recruited healthy adults aged ≥18 years living in the Sungai Segamat subdistrict. The exclusion criteria included: presence of fever (infrared forehead thermometer ≥37.5 °C at time of recruitment), history of yellow fever and Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccination/disease, pregnant women, and patients with terminal illness, organ failure, mental illness, cancer, and/or underlying bleeding disorders.
